title: Pronoun Usage Quiz
description: He, him, who, whom? Test your knowledge of proper pronoun usage and avoid common mistakes.

questions.question: Which is correct? '___ and I went to the store.'
When should you use 'whom' instead of 'who'?
options: When it is the object of a verb or preposition
When it is the subject of a clause

questions.question: Which is correct? '___ did you give the book to?'
Which sentence uses 'myself' correctly?
options: John and myself went to the game.
Myself and John went to the game.

questions.question: Which is correct? 'The winners were Tom and ___.'
Which pronoun correctly refers to 'everyone'?
options: All are considered acceptable in modern usage

questions.question: Which is correct? 'She is taller than ___.'
options: Both A and B depending on context

questions.question: What type of pronoun is 'this' in 'This is my book'?
Which is correct? 'The teacher spoke to John and ___.'
What is an antecedent?
options: A verb that comes before a noun
The word a pronoun refers to

questions.question: Which sentence has a clear pronoun reference?
options: John was happy when he met Bob.
When John met Bob, he was happy.
He was happy when John met Bob.

questions.question: Which is correct? '___ going to be a great day!'
What is wrong with 'Each student must bring their own pencil' in traditional grammar?
options: 'Their' is plural but 'each student' is singular
Nothing is wrong; it is always correct
